place.name: BLO NORTON
place.gazetteerText: BLO-NORTON, or Norton-Belleau, a parish in Guiltcross district, Norfolk; at the verge of the county, on the river Waveney, 5½ miles S by E of Harling Road r. station, and 9½ ESE of Thetford. Post Town, Garboldisham, under Thetford. Acres, 1,132. Real property, £2,395. Pop., 370. Houses, 87. The property is much subdivided. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £336. Patron, the Rev.H. Browne. The church is very good. There are Independent and P. Methodist chapels, and charities £97. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
